user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ahc_echo:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
ahc_echo (void *cls,
          struct MHD_Connection *connection,
          const char *url,
          const char *method,
          const char *version,
          const char *upload_data, size_t *upload_data_size, void **req_cls)
{
  static int aptr;
  struct handler_param *param = (struct handler_param *) cls;
  struct MHD_Response *response;
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  (void) cls;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) url;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) version;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data;       /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data_size;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if ((0 != strcmp (method, "GET")) && (0 != strcmp (method, "POST")))
    return MHD_NO;              /* unexpected method */

  if (&aptr != *req_cls)
  {
    *req_cls = &aptr;

    /* always to busy for POST requests */
    if (0 == strcmp (method, "POST"))
    {
      response =
        MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (BUSYPAGE),
                                                (const void *) BUSYPAGE);
      ret =
        MHD_queue_response (connection, MHD_HTTP_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE,
                            response);
      MHD_destroy_response (response);
      return ret;
    }
  }

  *req_cls = NULL;                  /* reset when done */
  response =
    MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (param->response_page),
                                            (const void *)
                                            param->response_page);
  ret = MHD_queue_response (connection, MHD_HTTP_OK, response);
  MHD_destroy_response (response);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function ahc_echo:
struct handler_param
{
  const char *response_page;
}
...
#define BUSYPAGE "<html><head><title>Webserver busy</title></head>""<body>We are too busy to process POSTs right now.</body></html>"
...
enum MHD_Result
{
  /**
   * MHD result code for "NO".
   */
  MHD_NO = 0,

  /**
   * MHD result code for "YES".
   */
  MHD_YES = 1

}
...
struct MHD_Connection
...
struct MHD_Response
...
#define MHD_HTTP_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE 503
...
#define MHD_HTTP_OK 200
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no uses of compiler-specific language extensions in the provided code. The following constructs that might look unusual are standard C, not extensions, so they do not trigger MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2: - (void) parameter casts to suppress unused-parameter warnings. - Casting between void * and typed pointers (e.g. (struct handler_param *) cls). - Taking the address of a static local (static int aptr) and storing/comparing it via void * (via req_cls). - Adjacent string literal concatenation (the BUSYPAGE macro uses two quoted strings). - Use of enum, struct, #define macros and function calls. - No uses of known compiler-specific extensions such as __attribute__, __asm__, typeof, statement expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, __extension__, GNU builtins, pragmas outside standard C, or other vendor-specific tokens. Therefore there are no code fragments to report for investigation under Rule 1.2.
